(Simplified: 剥)
Pictophonetic: 彔 indicates the sound; 刂 (knife) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
剝皮 [ bāo pí ]: to skin; to flay; to excoriate; to peel; to bark at sb; to physically punish sb
剝皮鉗 [ bāo pí qián ]: wire stripper
剝削 [ bō xuē ]: to exploit; exploitation
剝奪 [ bō duó ]: to deprive; to expropriate; to strip (sb of his property)
剝離 [ bō lí ]: to peel; to strip; to peel off; to come off (of tissue, skin, covering etc)
剝削階級 [ bō xuē jiē jí ]: exploiting class (in Marxist theory)
剝落 [ bō luò ]: to peel off

    • 彔 [ lù ] to carve wood
    • 刂 [ dāo ] knife
heisig_chinese_memo: The snowman likes to peel off the hard icey layers around the outside of his body with his saber arms that the children gave him.
heisig_constituent: peel off, dustpan, broom, grains of rice, sword, sabre, saber
Keyword_KKLC: STRIP OFF, peel off, come off
koohiiStory1: Peel off the outside of the broom that sweeps up rice grains to reveal a saber.
koohiiStory2: A multi-purpose broom! It cleans, it sweeps (rice!), it hits! In fact, peel off the mahogany exterior to uncover a sabre! It slices, it dices, it kills!
kunYomi: へ.ぐ、へず.る、む.く、む.ける、は.がれる、は.ぐ、は.げる、は.がす
jp_example_words:
剥がす(はがす): to tear off, to peel off, to rip off, to strip off, to skin, to flay, to disrobe, to deprive of, to detach, to disconnect
剥ぐ(はぐ): to tear off, to peel off, to rip off, to strip off, to skin, to flay, to disrobe, to deprive of
剥げる(はげる): to come off, to be worn off, to fade, to discolor
剥す(はがす): tear off, peel off, rip off, strip off, skin, flay, disrobe, deprive of, detach, disconnect
剥く(むく): peel, skin, pare, hull
jp_readingExamples: 剥がす (は.がす), 剥ぐ (は.ぐ)
Ru_trainchinese:
bāo: (глаг) снимать кожуру, очищать
bō: (графема) снимать кожуру, очищать (используется в составных словах)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: your snout (彑) gets watery (氺) as you use the sword (刂) to peel off
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Peel off the outside of the broom that sweeps up rice grains to reveal a saber.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " knife ", from " record ", " record " also sounds, " stripping " is also " 𠚩 ", the original meaning is split. "Shuowen": "Peel, crack. From the knife to record. Record, to cut. The recording also sounds. 𠚩, peel or from the divination." Qi Tuo." Du's note: "Qi, axe. Tuo, handle. Break Guiyu to decorate the handle of the axe."

" Stripping " can mean cutting. "Poetry‧Xiaoya‧Xin Nanshan": "There are houses in Zhongtian, and melons in the frontiers. It is the ancestor of the emperor." Zheng Xuanjian: "Explore the stains for the ancestor."

" Peeling " also means removing the skin. "Poetry·Xiaoya·Chuci": "Yi'er cattle and sheep, in the past, they tasted, either peeled or prospered (cooked), or eaten or will." Zhu Xi's note: "Peel, unpeel its skin."

" Peeling " also means falling off. "Lun Heng·Leixu" by Han Wang Chong: "When the iron is dissipated in the smelting industry, it takes the shape of soil. If it is dry, the iron will be underneath. If it is not, the skin will burn and peel."

" Deprivation " also means exploitation and plunder. "New Tang Book-Biography of Pei Yanling": "Yanling is demanding and profitable, so he just peels off and attaches it, trying to behave like a monster."

" Stripping " also refers to removal and expulsion. The third fold of Yuan Baipu's "Indus Rain": "Deprived him of office and demoted him to be a poor citizen."

" Bo " is also the hexagram name of "Yi". In the whole hexagram, there is only one yang line at the top and five yin lines at the bottom. The yin qi is high and the yang qi is declining, which symbolizes the villain's power and the gentleman's disadvantage. Later, bad luck is stripping. Song Yeshi "He Gong's Participation in Politics": "Those who gather things must rise, and those who strip away yin must regain yang."
humanum_short_description_en: From " knife ", from " record ", " record " is also pronounced , " stripping " is also called " 𠚩 ", the original meaning is split.
humanum_full_description:
從「刀」，從「录」，「录」亦聲，「剝」亦作「𠚩」，本義為割裂。《說文》：「剝，裂也。从刀从录。录，刻割也。录亦聲。𠚩，剥或从卜。」《左傳‧昭公十二年》：「君王命剝圭以為鏚柲。」杜預注：「鏚，斧也。柲，柄也。破圭玉以飾斧柄。」

　　「剝」可表示削。《詩‧小雅‧信南山》：「中田有廬，疆埸有瓜，是剝是菹，獻之皇祖。」鄭玄箋：「剝削淹漬以為菹。」

　　「剝」也表示去掉外皮。《詩‧小雅‧楚茨》：「絜爾牛羊，以往烝嘗，或剝或亨（烹），或肆或將。」朱熹注：「剝，解剝其皮也。」

　　「剝」還表示脫落。漢王充《論衡‧雷虛》：「當冶工之消鐵也，以土為形，燥則鐵下，不則躍溢而射。射中人身，則皮膚灼剝。」

　　「剝」亦表示盤剝、掠奪。《新唐書‧裴延齡傳》：「延齡資苛刻，又劫於利，專剝下附上，肆騁譎怪。」

　　「剝」還指罷免、革除。元白樸《梧桐雨》第三摺：「把他剝了官職，貶做窮民。」

　　「剝」也是《易》的卦名。全卦六爻，僅一條陽爻在上，而五條陰爻在下，陰氣盛，陽氣衰，象徵小人得勢，君子不利。後謂時運不利為剝。宋葉適〈賀龔參政〉：「然物之萃者勢必升，陰之剝者陽必復。」
humanum_short_description: 從「刀」，從「录」，「录」亦聲，「剝」亦作「𠚩」，本義為割裂。

從「 刀 」，從「 录 」，「 录 」亦聲，「 剝 」亦作「 𠚩 」，本義為割裂。《說文》：「剝，裂也。从刀从录。录，刻割也。录亦聲。𠚩，剥或从卜。」《左傳‧昭公十二年》：「君王命剝圭以為鏚柲。」杜預注：「鏚，斧也。柲，柄也。破圭玉以飾斧柄。」 「 剝 」可表示削。《詩‧小雅‧信南山》：「中田有廬，疆埸有瓜，是剝是菹，獻之皇祖。」鄭玄箋：「剝削淹漬以為菹。」 「 剝 」也表示去掉外皮。《詩‧小雅‧楚茨》：「絜爾牛羊，以往烝嘗，或剝或亨（烹），或肆或將。」朱熹注：「剝，解剝其皮也。」 「 剝 」還表示脫落。漢王充《論衡‧雷虛》：「當冶工之消鐵也，以土為形，燥則鐵下，不則躍溢而射。射中人身，則皮膚灼剝。」 「 剝 」亦表示盤剝、掠奪。《新唐書‧裴延齡傳》：「延齡資苛刻，又劫於利，專剝下附上，肆騁譎怪。」 「 剝 」還指罷免、革除。元白樸《梧桐雨》第三摺：「把他剝了官職，貶做窮民。」 「 剝 」也是《易》的卦名。全卦六爻，僅一條陽爻在上，而五條陰爻在下，陰氣盛，陽氣衰，象徵小人得勢，君子不利。後謂時運不利為剝。宋葉適〈賀龔參政〉：「然物之萃者勢必升，陰之剝者陽必復。」
From " knife", from " record", " record" also sounds, " stripping" is also " 𠚩", the original meaning is split. "Shuowen": "Peel, crack. From the knife to record. Record, to cut. The recording also sounds. 𠚩, peel or from the divination." Qi Tuo." Du's note: "Qi, axe. Tuo, handle. Break Guiyu to decorate the handle of the axe." " Stripping" can mean cutting. "Poetry‧Xiaoya‧Xin Nanshan": "There are houses in Zhongtian, and melons in the frontiers. It is the ancestor of the emperor." Zheng Xuanjian: "Explore the stains for the ancestor." " Peeling" also means removing the skin. "Poetry·Xiaoya·Chuci": "Yi'er cattle and sheep, in the past, they tasted, either peeled or prospered (cooked), or eaten or will." Zhu Xi's note: "Peel, unpeel its skin." " Peeling" also means falling off. "Lun Heng·Leixu" by Han Wang Chong: "When the iron is dissipated in the smelting industry, it takes the shape of soil. If it is dry, the iron will be underneath. If it is not, the skin will burn and peel." " Deprivation" also means exploitation and plunder. "New Tang Book-Biography of Pei Yanling": "Yanling is demanding and profitable, so he just peels off and attaches it, trying to behave like a monster." " Stripping" also refers to removal and expulsion. The third fold of Yuan Baipu's "Indus Rain": "Deprived him of office and demoted him to be a poor citizen." " Bo" is also the hexagram name of "Yi". In the whole hexagram, there is only one yang line at the top and five yin lines at the bottom. The yin qi is high and the yang qi is declining, which symbolizes the villain's power and the gentleman's disadvantage. Later, bad luck is stripping. Song Yeshi "He Gong's Participation in Politics": "Those who gather things must rise, and those who strip away yin must regain yang."

剝字的康熙字典解释

【子集下】【刀字部】　剝； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页141第21
〔古文〕?【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】?北角切，音駁。【說文】裂也。从刀，彔聲。【玉篇】削也。【廣韻】落也，割也，傷害也。【楚辭·九思】怫鬱兮肝切剝。又【增韻】褫也，脫也。又卦名。【易·剝卦】剝也，柔變剛也。又【周禮·秋官·柞氏】冬日至，令剝隂木而水之。【註】謂斫去次地之皮。又殺牲體解之名。【詩·小雅】或剝或亨。又【禮·檀弓】喪不剝奠也與。【註】剝者，不巾覆也。脯醢之奠不惡塵埃，故可無巾覆。又【集韻】普木切【正韻】普卜切，?音璞。力擊也。【詩·豳風】八月剝棗。【註】擊也。又音卜。【魏·劉楨·魯都賦】毛羣隕殪，羽族殲剝。塡崎塞畎，不可勝錄。【集韻】或作?，亦作?。

剝字的源字形

字源演变：

甲骨文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体旧字形
剝字的起名意思

暂无。

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Subset 2] [Knife word department] 　 strip; Kangxi strokes: 10; page number: page 141-21
[Ancient text]? [Tang Yun] [Jiyun] [Yunhui]? North Point cut, sound barbed. [Said the text] Split also. From the knife, hum. [Jade articles] Cut too. [Guang Yun] Fall, cut, hurt. [Songs of the Chu·Nine Thoughts] Depressed and severe. [Zeng Yun] Yu Ye, take it off. Also hexagram name. [Easy Peeling Gua] Peeling, soft and rigid. Also【Zhou Li·Qiuguan·Zuo Shi】Winter solstice, so that the yin wood is peeled and the water becomes water. [Note] It is said that the skin of the second place is plucked. Also in the name of killing animals and disintegrating. 【Poetry·Xiaoya】Or peel or prosper. Also【Li·Tan Gong】Mourning is not stripped of ceremony. [Note] Those who are stripped will not be covered. The ceremonial ceremonial ceremony does not hate dust, so it can be covered without a towel. Also 【Ji Yun】Pu Muqie【Zheng Yun】Pu Buqie,? Yin Pu. Also hit hard. 【Poetry·Binfeng】Peeling dates in August. [Note] Hit also. And sound Bu. 【Wei·Liuzhen·Ludu Fu】The Mao Qun died, and the feather tribe was wiped out. It is unbeatable to record. [Ji Yun] Or for?, also for?.
